mapreduce.jobtracker.taskscheduler org.apache.hadoop.mapred.JobQueueTaskScheduler The class responsible for scheduling the tasks.
mapreduce.map.log.level INFO The logging level for the map task. The allowed levels are: OFF, FATAL, ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG, TRACE and ALL.
mapreduce.reduce.log.level INFO The logging level for the reduce task. The allowed levels are: OFF, FATAL, ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG, TRACE and ALL.
mapreduce.framework.name yarn
**通常配置完成不修改。 The runtime framework for executing MapReduce jobs. Can be one of local, classic or yarn.
yarn.app.mapreduce.am.command-opts -Xmx1024m Java opts for the MR App Master processes. The following symbol, if present, will be interpolated: @taskid@ is replaced by current TaskID. Any other occurrences of '@' will go unchanged. For example, to enable verbose gc logging to a file named for the taskid in /tmp and to set the heap maximum to be a gigabyte, pass a 'value' of: -Xmx1024m -verbose:gc -Xloggc:/tmp/@taskid@.gc
Usage of -Djava.library.path can cause programs to no longer function if hadoop native libraries are used. These values should instead be set as part of LD_LIBRARY_PATH in the map / reduce JVM env using the mapreduce.map.env and mapreduce.reduce.env config settings.
yarn.app.mapreduce.am.resource.mb 1536 The amount of memory the MR AppMaster needs.
yarn.app.mapreduce.am.resource.cpu-vcores 1
The number of virtual CPU cores the MR AppMaster needs.
